```go
package main

	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := rekognition.NewCollection(ctx, "example", &rekognition.CollectionArgs{
			CollectionId: pulumi.String("my-collection"),
			Tags: pulumi.StringMap{
				"example": pulumi.String("1"),
			},
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```

The following reference example uses placeholder values for all [input properties](#inputs).

<pulumi-chooser type="language" options="csharp,go,typescript,python,yaml,java"></pulumi-chooser>
</div>


<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">

```csharp
var collectionResource = new Aws.Rekognition.Collection("collectionResource", new()
{
    CollectionId = "string",
    Tags = 
    {
        { "string", "string" },
    },
    Timeouts = new Aws.Rekognition.Inputs.CollectionTimeoutsArgs
    {
        Create = "string",
    },
});
```

</pulumi-choosable>
</div>


<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="go">

```go
example, err := rekognition.NewCollection(ctx, "collectionResource", &rekognition.CollectionArgs{
	CollectionId: pulumi.String("string"),
	Tags: pulumi.StringMap{
		"string": pulumi.String("string"),
	},
	Timeouts: &rekognition.CollectionTimeoutsArgs{
		Create: pulumi.String("string"),
	},
})
```

</pulumi-choosable>
</div>


<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="java">

```java
var collectionResource = new Collection("collectionResource", CollectionArgs.builder()
    .collectionId("string")
    .tags(Map.of("string", "string"))
    .timeouts(CollectionTimeoutsArgs.builder()
        .create("string")
        .build())
    .build());
```

</pulumi-choosable>
</div>


<div>

```python
    collection_id="string",
    tags={
        "string": "string",
    },
    timeouts={
        "create": "string",
    })
```

</pulumi-choosable>

<p>The following arguments are optional:</p>

    </dt>
    <dd>Map of tags assigned to the resource. If configured with a provider <code>default_tags</code> configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="timeouts_python">

    </dt>

    </dt>
    <dd>A bag of options that control this resource's behavior.</dd>
</dl>

</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="java">

<dl class="resources-properties">
    <dt class="property-required" title="Required">
        <span>name</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The unique name of the resulting resource.</dd>
    <dt class="property-required" title="Required">
        <span>id</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The <em>unique</em> provider ID of the resource to lookup.</dd>
    <dt class="property-optional" title="Optional">
        <span>state</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Any extra arguments used during the lookup.</dd>
    <dt class="property-optional" title="Optional">
        <span>opts</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>A bag of options that control this resource's behavior.</dd>
</dl>

## Supporting Types



<h4 id="collectiontimeouts">

<div>

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>A string that can be <a href="https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration">parsed as a duration</a> consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as &quot;30s&quot; or &quot;2h45m&quot;. Valid time units are &quot;s&quot; (seconds), &quot;m&quot; (minutes), &quot;h&quot; (hours).</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

</div>

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import Rekognition Collection using the `example_id_arg`. For example:

```sh
$ pulumi import aws:rekognition/collection:Collection example collection-id-12345678
```


To learn more about importing existing cloud resources, see [Importing resources](/docs/using-pulumi/adopting-pulumi/import/).
